name: Weekly Client Report
description: Weekly status report for client delivery

sections.name: what_working_on
sections.title: 1. What are you working on?
sections.ai_instruction: Summarize work completed and in progress this week in client-friendly language. Focus on business value and outcomes, not technical implementation details. Use sub-items (a., b., c.) for each major area of work. Avoid jargon. Be specific but concise. If minimal work this week, still provide meaningful summary.

sections.name: completion_timeline
sections.title: 2. When do you plan to complete these tasks?
sections.ai_instruction: Provide estimated completion timelines for ongoing work. Use sub-items (a., b., c.) for each task with its timeline. Be realistic and specific with dates when possible. If tasks are already complete, note that. Use business-friendly language. If no pending tasks, output: 'a. All current tasks completed.'

sections.name: risks_blockers
sections.title: 3. Do you have any Risks or Blockers?
sections.ai_instruction: Identify any risks or blockers that are CLIENT-APPROPRIATE to share. Focus on items that may impact delivery or require client action. Present professionally with proposed solutions when possible. Use sub-items (a., b., c.). Avoid sharing internal-only issues. If no client-facing risks or blockers, output: 'a. None at this time.'

sections.name: unclear_requests
sections.title: 4. Did you receive any requests you are unsure of?
sections.ai_instruction: Analyze notes for any requests, requirements, or expectations that need clarification from the client. This could include ambiguous requirements, conflicting guidance, or areas needing more detail. Use sub-items (a., b., c.) for each item needing clarification. Be diplomatic and professional. If everything is clear, output: 'a. All requests and requirements are clear.'

sections.name: artifacts_location
sections.title: 5. Location of Artifacts
sections.ai_instruction: Identify locations of deliverables, documentation, or artifacts created this week. This could include repository links, shared documents, reports, or other outputs. Use sub-items (a., b., c.) for each artifact location. Be specific with paths or URLs when mentioned in notes. If no new artifacts this week, output: 'a. No new artifacts this week. Existing materials remain in previously shared locations.'
